title: How to Make Elderflower Granita

steps.headline: Pour the elderflower cordial into the freezer-proof container.
steps.description: Add the spring water. Stir together.

steps.headline: Place the container into the freezer and leave to freeze overnight.
Remove from the freezer the following day.
steps.description: Place in the fridge for 15 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove from the fridge.
steps.description: Drag a fork across the top of the frozen granita ice, dragging up flaking pieces of ice.

steps.headline: Place the granita into a fresh container.
steps.description: It is ready for serving, or you can freeze it again until serving time.

steps.headline: Make a rosemary infusion.
steps.description: Bring 1/2 cup water to the boil. Add the fresh or dried rosemary to the water. Remove from the heat. Set aside for 1/2 an hour to infuse. Added flavour can be released by pressing down on the rosemary leaves with a spoon.

steps.headline: Cut up the cucumber.
steps.description: Add the pieces to the blender or food processor with the elderflower cordial. Blend or process to a purée.

steps.headline: After the rosemary infusion has steeped long enough, strain to remove the sprigs or leaves.
Pour the infusion and the cucumber mixture together in a bowl.
steps.description: Add the lemon or lime juice and stir to combine.

steps.headline: Place into a suitable container for freezing.
steps.description: Add a cover and place in the freezer. After 2 hours, remove from the freezer and break up with a fork. This helps the ice crystals to form properly. Continue doing this every hour until the granita freezes properly.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Scoop the granita into dessert bowls and serve. Garnish with a cucumber curl or a small sprig of rosemary.

steps.headline: Make a ginger infusion.
steps.description: Add the ginger and water to the pan. Bring to the boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the lemon juice and sugar.
Remove from the heat.
steps.description: Strain into a bowl. Let stand to cool thoroughly.

steps.headline: Add the pomegranate juice and seeds and elderflower cordial.
Place the mixture into a suitable freezing container.
steps.description: Place in the freezer. After 2 hours, remove from the freezer and break up with a fork. This helps the ice crystals to form properly. Continue doing this every hour until the granita freezes properly. It is ready when the consistency is light and icy.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Scoop the granita in dessert bowls. Garnish with pomegranate seeds.

text: Elderflower cordial granita Pour the elderflower cordial into the freezer-proof container. Add the spring water. Stir together. Place the container into the freezer and leave to freeze overnight.  Remove from the freezer the following day. Place in the fridge for 15 minutes. Remove from the fridge. Drag a fork across the top of the frozen granita ice, dragging up flaking pieces of ice. Place the granita into a fresh container. It is ready for serving, or you can freeze it again until serving time. Elderflower, cucumber and rosemary granita Make a rosemary infusion. Bring 1/2 cup water to the boil. Add the fresh or dried rosemary to the water. Remove from the heat. Set aside for 1/2 an hour to infuse. Added flavour can be released by pressing down on the rosemary leaves with a spoon. Cut up the cucumber. Add the pieces to the blender or food processor with the elderflower cordial. Blend or process to a purée. After the rosemary infusion has steeped long enough, strain to remove the sprigs or leaves.  Pour the infusion and the cucumber mixture together in a bowl. Add the lemon or lime juice and stir to combine. Place into a suitable container for freezing. Add a cover and place in the freezer. After 2 hours, remove from the freezer and break up with a fork. This helps the ice crystals to form properly. Continue doing this every hour until the granita freezes properly. Serve. Scoop the granita into dessert bowls and serve. Garnish with a cucumber curl or a small sprig of rosemary. Elderflower and pomegranate granita Make a ginger infusion. Add the ginger and water to the pan. Bring to the boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the lemon juice and sugar. Stir until dissolved. Remove from the heat. Strain into a bowl. Let stand to cool thoroughly. Add the pomegranate juice and seeds and elderflower cordial. Stir through. Place the mixture into a suitable freezing container. Place in the freezer. After 2 hours, remove from the freezer and break up with a fork. This helps the ice crystals to form properly. Continue doing this every hour until the granita freezes properly. It is ready when the consistency is light and icy. Serve. Scoop the granita in dessert bowls. Garnish with pomegranate seeds.
